p: The Dai people of southern China have been using Piper flaviflorum as an ethnomedicine to treat dysmenorrhea and tinea. Moreover, the ethnic people in Xishuangbanna located at the southwestern Yunnan, China have been using the leaves and stems of P. flaviflorum as an indigenous remedy for inner heat, stomach disorder, and relief of pain and itching, in addition to being consumed as vegetables and spices [ 222, 223].
